title: OidcClient should not require 3 properties to point to a non-discoverable token endpoint
body:
### Description

Several users have to deal with configuring `OidcClient` to talk to non-standard OIDC or OAuth2 servers which do not support the discovery, for example:
```
quarkus.oidc-client.auth-server-url=http://server.com
quarkus.oidc-client.discovery-enabled=false

# Token endpoint: http://server.com/token
quarkus.oidc-client.token-path=/token
```

The first 2 properties should not be required given that even now `quarkus.oidc-client.token-path` can be set to an absolute URL such as `http://server.com/token`.

The above pattern is used because `OidcClientConfig` shares the common config with `OidcTenantConfig`, it makes sense for `quarkus-oidc` when dealing with the non-discoverable OIDC servers as typically a few endpoints path are needed, but in case of `OidcClient` the only endpoint URL which is needed is the token endpoint URL.

So only the following should work:
```
# These 2 properties are not necessary, and if set then they will be ignored if `token-path` is an absolute URL 
#quarkus.oidc-client.auth-server-url=http://server.com
#quarkus.oidc-client.discovery-enabled=false

quarkus.oidc-client.token-path=http://server.com/token
```

Note the original pattern can be still useful especially when combining `OidcClient` with `quarkus-oidc` where `quarkus.oidc-client` properties can refer to `quarkus.oidc` ones but it should not be required in all other cases

### Implementation ideas

If `quarkus.oidc-client.token-path` is an absolute URL then ignore `auth-server-url`
